Name: Bee Attitudes
Description:
From back of box:

Collect as many Bee Attitudes as you can, one by one.  There's "Bee Kind," "Bee Honest," "Bee Reverent" and yes, even "Bee Happy."  The more bees you collect, the more points you'll get.  But if you turn over a "Stinger Bee!"-all your points buzz away!  The player with the highest score wins.

Name: Word Wise
Description: Ages 8 and up. This interesting and educational game combines all the standard word games such as Anagrams and Crosswords plus the fun of using picture puns. 100 letters, 40 picture puns, hardwood letter rack for 2, 3, or 4 players.

Name: Checkpoint
Description:
From the instructions:
"Checkpoint is a collection of four 'gimmick' road rallies.  However, these events are not run on a road or highway, but on a game board, the World Wide Web... and in your mind.

"Each of the four Checkpoint road rallies is sort of an elaborate game of 'Simon Says' played out by moving your tiny car across a road map/game board.

"In each, you will follow a series of route instructions that the devious Rallymaster has specifically designed to mislead you.

"You shouldn't lose your way because all the various routes across the map lead to same ending.  However, the player who is best at remaining on the one true course... by spotting the Rallymaster's sinister tricks... will become the eventual winner."

The game also includes instructions for entering an online contest that started in November 1997.

Name: Abs-Trac-Toe
Description:
Object: To earn territory points by claiming adjacent territories on a semi-randomly created board.

Play: One player draws an irregularly-shaped figure on the paper. That player must divide it into nine sections by drawing two horizontal and two vertical lines. The other player gets to draw one line. This line must start and end at an outside edge. Starting with the player who did not draw the bending line, take turns marking vacant spaces, one at a time. The game ends when there are no vacant spaces left to fill.

Winning: Score one point for every interior border shared by spaces that you have claimed. Shared corners (vertices) do not count as shared borders.

Name: Down in Flames Squadron Pack 1: Fighters
Description:
(from GMT website:)

The one thing that Down in Flames series players are always looking for is additional aircraft for their favorite game series. So we have decided to satisfy that desire with our first C3i-DiF Squadron aircraft pack. This pack consists of 64 fighter aircraft cards, printed in the eight-per-sheet (cut 'em out yourself) style of C3i-DiF module inserts that you've enjoyed over the years. Most of the aircraft cards are NEW aircraft types, although we have included a few reprints (with corrected ratings) of aircraft that have appeared previously in one or more of the DiF Series games.

Included are such important aircraft as the British Typhoon and Tempest, the German Bf-109G-6/R6 and Fw-190F and the American P-63A Kingcobra (which was used extensively in combat by the Soviet air force). The pack also contains a number of more obscure but interesting aircraft, like the Rumanian IAR 80, the German TA-152H and the Polish PzL 24, the only fighter in the Greek inventory at the time of the Italian invasion in 1941. Speaking of the Italians, there are a number of Mussolini's fighters in the pack as well, including the Cr42 Falco, the M.C. 202 Folgore and the G.50bis Freccia. All of these planes are done in the upgraded graphic style of Corsairs and Hellcats, courtesy of Dave Lawrence, Martin Scott and Rodger MacGowan.

The package is wrapped in a ziplock format with an 11" x 17" (folded) cover/rulesbook. The front cover is graced with Rodger MacGowan's gorgeous DiF Series style artwork, while the inside will contain the rules necessary to use the aircraft in DiF dogfights. Some of the rules will be reprints from Zero!: The Rise and Fall of The Imperial Japanese Air Force Dec 1941 - June 1942 and Corsairs and Hellcats for the benefit of those players who only own the European Theatre DiF series volumes (Rise of the Luftwaffe and Eighth Air Force). There will also be a few new rules. For example, ace researcher Chris Janiec has come up with a way of modeling aircraft carrying a single, large caliber cannon, such as the P-39.

If this first C3i-DiF Squadron Pack proves to be popular, we're planning a series of these expansion packs. This is your chance to expand your Down in Flames series air force and add new aircraft cards at a very low price. Enjoy the games!

Name: Buried Treasure
Description:
From a hand dealt from a standard deck of cards, each player "buries" three cards by placing them face-down on the table. Then players create and add cards to four tableaus, by suit. Face cards allow players to take, or, in some cases, to lock-up, cards from the tableaus. The pips in each tableau count towards the players' score, multiplied by the number of cards of that suit the player originally buried.

Buried Treasure was published in the book Card Games Around the World.

Name: Pikes and Muskets
Description:
Described as an excellent family game from the National Trust, produced in 1984.  Now very scarce.

For 2-4 Players, Ages 5 and up.

Name: Fantz
Description: A Miniatures game featuring combat between bands of fantasy-archetype based F'antz (ants) warriors.   The starter set contains 5 Dwarf F'antz, 5 Elf F'antz, rules and a table cloth.  Also available are Barbarian, Barbarian Archers, Dwarf Crossbows, Elf Heavy Archers, Undead, and Undead Ogres, all in F'atz form.

Name: Putwoody's Castle
Description:
Putwoody's Castle is a Fine Free Game from Cheapass Games.

The board consists of a 5 x 4 grid representing the castle.  Owners of the game supply their own colored stones (5 red, 8 blue, 11 white). On a player's turn he places a stone of any available color on any empty space in the castle. The player immediately scores 1 point for every stone of the same color adjacent to the placed stone.

The winner is the player with the most points.
Families: Series: Chief Herman's Next Big Thing

Name: In Clouds of Glory
Description:
In Clouds of Glory (ICOG)is a tabletop air wargame that recreates aerial combat during the World War One. The game was developed in Denmark the 90's by 3 friends with a common passion for the WWI "Knights of the Air".

The game features true 3-D action with accurate models of all the greatest planes of this era: SPADs, Sopwiths, Fokkers, Pfalz´es, Nieuports, Hannovers, Rumplers, Albatrosses, Bristols, Gothas, Zeppelins, S.Es...

The game represents individual plane movement and individual pilots. 
Each plane is represented by a 1/350 scale model with at 360 deg. nose mount that allows the model to be positioned in all directions. The nose mount is then itself mounted on a four foot long pole made of carbon fibre. The plan can then be moved up and down the pole, thus denoting actual height - No altitude markers here. The pole is sharpened and set directly into the foam gameboards. See pictures.

Each plane also has a "Cockpit" sheet to which the Pilot sheet is attached and where the data (and possible special rules)on each plane type is represented. On the cockpit sheet also contains a speed indicator telling the current speed of the plane, and indicating the amount of energy the plane currently posses. This energy level tells how tigth the plane can turn and its ability to climb or dive. Going fast equals the ability to zoom high up, but turns are wide. Going slow allows for tighter turning but severely limits your ability to get out of trouble by zoom climbing and thus limits the tactical options. In this game speed is life.

Piloting skill can make planes turn tigther than their speed normally allows for, but this drains speed and at higher speeds also stresses the airframe, thus creating a risk of breaking of important bits such as the wings.

The "Cockpit" sheet is also where you record damage to the plane: Structural damage, damage to maneuverability, armament, engine and so on.

Each pilot has a set of 3 basic skills: Awareness (situational awareness), Piloting (ability to make tight turns, avoid or recover from spins and stalls)  and Gunnery (hitting your target). A pilots skills are decided by rolling 2d6+6. Pilots also has 2 attributes: Fortitude (hit points and ability to figth when wounded) and Luck (Denotes number of dice re-rolls and Used to check for collisions) found by rolling 3d6. With experience pilots gain better skills as well as possible "Ace abilities" such as Divine luck, Deflection shooting, Aerobatics and so on.

Skill and attribute checks are done with a d20 against a basic target number (for example Skill or Attribute level) modified by conditions (for example deflection angle or target speed). The difference between the target number needed and a the number rolled on a successful check denotes the success level which is then carried on as a modifier to the damage roll.

The full rules including, missions and Cockpit panels and more can be downloaded for free here:http://icog.dk/ICOG/Download.html

1/350 scale planes can be acquired as 3D prints(or hand build in styrene as you see on many of the pictures). A large selection of planes is available for the game. Links to these can be found on the ICOG homepage: http://icog.dk/ICOG/Links.html

Name: Andromeda Foundation Official Battle Manual
Description:
This is a slightly altered version of the rulebook for Battle for Andromeda: Conflict for a Trillion Suns!. It was included as the series rulebook for Galaxy-Foundation Games' other strategic games (Deliverance From Beyond the Stars, The Xenon Empire's Star Wars: Crusade Against the War-Lords, and The Collodian Conspiracy: Science Against Chaos Unleashed), and also appears to have been sold separately. It may have come with some Combat Operations Plots when sold separately (these were used in all of GFG's strategic games).

The cover of the Battle Manual is done in the style of a military field manual. Under the obligatory number (OBM-76A-171) it states "For Fleet Commanders and Officers of Flag Rank." The manual is also marked CLASSIFIED DATA, noting "under official regulations, any attempt to reproduce, pass on, reveal, or place in possession of unauthorized personnel constitutes a violation of military law under the military code, espionage and sabotage acts and is punishable under the penalties regarding treason."

The Combat Operations Plot is a large chart designed to assist in setting the current configuration of your starship. There are 23 separate Operations Plots displayed, each specifying the various ship settings for the forthcoming turn.

The values specified in an Operations Plot include Offensive Power Level, Defensive Power Level, Shield Potential, Counter-Attack Factor, Defense Factor, Sensor Screen Penetration, and Rate of Warp (acceleration and deceleration). Each Operations Plot is given a descriptive name, ranging from the straightforward "Full Shields" and "Total Offensive Weapons Deployment", to more convoluted selections such as "Special High Speed Evasive Action Plan for 'A' Type Beta Battle Cruisers or 'CR' Type 'Gammas'."

Name: Hail Caesar!
Description:
Hail Caesar! is a miniatures gladiator game created by David P. Gundt and his local gaming club, Melees Gloriosus.

"Hail Caesar!" is a simple "beer and pretzels" type gladiator game in which character have simple statistics (strength, stamina, speed, dexterity, skill) and are pitted against each other.

What really makes the game fun is the amount of research that Mr. Gundt put into the game. Rules for ten different types  of gladiators and a great plethora of weaponry and armor are included with the game. Perhaps the most interesting are the rules included for the Andabates type gladiator, a gladiator that fought blind with a full-head helmet, sort of like Luke Skywalker in "Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope."

Hail Caesar! is a fun "beer and pretzels" gladiator game.

Name: Freddy the Fireman
Description: It's a children's race game. Race to be the first to get to your fireman to the fire.

Name: Magi
Description:
Another version of UNO with twist and tricky cards.
Brilliant and charming illustrations of a fantasy theme.

There were three magic kingdomes (Yellow, Red and Blue) battling each other. Almost peaole belonged one of the kingdoms. But Magi (Great Magicians) were independent from any country. Thus Magi could make peace or flame up the wars.

Color of cards means suit belongs. And all playing cards have rank number.

There are three categories for Playing cards.

Guild cards: No distinctive feature. They have only color and rank.

Item cards: Defense or Attack cards for battle with another player.

Magi cards: Wild cards. Without color, but they have rank and Special Powers.

Object of each round is to get rid of your hand cards as quickly as possible. At the end of the round, your hand cards produce negative points.

The game continues until the first player accumulates negative 50 points.

Name: Hijacked
Description: Features gun playing pieces - there are 5 present, money pack, game board, rules.  As the Hijacker you negotiate for the highest dollar award for your hostages.  The winner escapes with the cash.

Name: The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: New Moon
Description:
New Moon, the first expansion for The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow, requires the base game in order to play and it adds to the game:


     36 event cards
     5 new roles for the villagers: the idiot, the elder, the piper, the scapegoat, the savior
     9 new variants/playing suggestions, e.g., playing in the dark with a candle in front of each player's face and blowing the candle out when the player dies, or instead of the werewolves eating civilians, they contaminate the civilians, leaving them without rights or powers
     Rules allowing for many game variants

Name: Franklin
Description: It's Franklin's birthday and his friends are bringing presents. On his turn, a player spins the spinner. Franklin is moved first, then the player token. When a player ends up in a present square of his player color, or shares a square with Franklin, he can give a present to Franklin. Then the player must go and pick up another present from his starting square. The first player to deliver three presents to Franklin wins the game.

Name: Dimitri Donskoi
Description: Battle of Kulikovo 1380 between the Russians of Dimitri Donskoi and the Mongols which ended in a victory for Russia. In Russian language only.

Name: The Great Boer War Board Game
Description:
Game of the Second Boer War commencing October, 1899.

Game comes in a small 9" x 6 1/2" x 7/8" box with a cover illustration of a well-dressed Victorian family playing a map-and-pin flags boardgame of the war.

The cardstock hex map measures 16 1/2" x 11 5/8" and depicts the region of conflict running from cape Town and Port Elizabeth in the south to Mateking in the west, the Rhodesian border in the north and the port of Lourenco Marques in the east.

Map has one-inch hexes featuring Clear, Hill, Railway, River, and Mountain terrain plus economic centers and ports.  The mounted, pre-cut 3/4" counters featuring forty green Boer Commandos of various strengths, Command Flags (three per player), two Natives, thirty-five "Gold" (Supplies), twenty red British Infantry brigades, twelve red British Cavalry brigades, and five red British Garrisons plus a Turn Marker.  Two D6 are also included.

Unit counters feature, as appropriate, a drawing of a Boer horseman firing at the gallop, native shields, national flags, British lancer, British infantry, and a field gun with crew (for garrisons).  Counters include deployment location or turn of appearance, combat strength, and movement allowance.  Historical unit identifications are also included.

Normal game length is fifteen turns (victory determined by holding the most economic production centers) or, optionally, thirty-six turns (pursuing the bittereinder to the last counter; if one survives to the end, the Boers win).

Rules cover reinforcements, the British War Chest, Natives, Neutrals, Railways, Sea and Off-map Movement, Multi-hex combat, Sieges, and the assymetrical nature of opposing forces.

Movement is handled in a distinctive way.  Each turn, Boer and British players alternate placing a "flag" on the map (numbered between One and Six).  After placement, players alternate moving units adjacent to these flags.  Units must stop if they move adjacent to a hostile unit.  Following this "Consolidation Movement," Combat occurs.

After Combat, surviving units may engage in "Dispersal Movement," which is the opposite of Consolidation Movement.  Movement to and from flags takes place sequentially in the order of numbered flags.

Optionally, players may place their flags simultaneously rather than sequentially; in this instance, players plot the hex number where each flag will be placed.  Another option allows for random flag draws from a cup.

Combat is determined by odds ration and a singld D6 die roll.  The resulting number indicates the "Butcher's Bill" imposed upon either the S (smaller force) or L (larger force) engaged.  Losses are in units removed; the Boer player may retreat in lieu of taking losses if his units may retreat the full amount (one or two) and not move next to any British or native unit.  "Gold" (supplies) may not retreat and may be captured.

Name: Dotty Dragon
Description: "Dotty Dragon has gone too far now. So his Aunt Dragolina has cast a spell and lots of colored spots have appeared on his face. Poor Dotty! How is he going to get rid of these spots? Only with the help of two children who simply place Dotty Dragon in the middle, and off they go! If they throw the matching color on the colored dice they can make the dragon's spots disappear. Because Dotty's colorful spots can easily be pushed through to the other side of the vertical game display and Dotty is quickly rid of his spots."

Name: Create-a-picture
Description:
"Build a cottage, barn or schoolhouse, plant a garden and make it grow.

Create-a-picture is a unique noncompetitive game that develops creative expression in school-age children.

Players create pictures using interchangeable mosaic cards. with 126 cards to choose from, the possibilities are as limitless as a child's imagination."
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Tiere auf dem Bauernhof
Description: Roll the die to build farm animals. A horse, sheep, cow and a pig.

Name: U.S.I.Q.
Description:
U.S.I.Q. By the National Center for Constitutional Studies NCCS 1986

An Exciting Quiz Game to Celebrate the 200th Birthday of the U.S. Constitution

Includes rules for 2 to a classroom full of players. A great teaching aid for US History.

Contents complete.5 Copy's of the Constitution,5 constitution at a glance pamphlets,instructions for two types of play small group and classroom, HUNDREDS OF QUESTION CARDS WITH POINT VALUES.

Name: Biogenics: The Game of a Lifetime
Description:
The object is to stay alive and make enough BIO-ENERGY(in the form of chemical ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate) to meet the various challenges of life. Without energy, life ends. A great amount of energy is required to produce the next generation.

The player who gets the BABY first is the WINNER and is awarded a winning card. To win requires skill, strategy and luck-the ingredients that make life more enjoyable.

On the other hand, avoid accumulating too many harmful WASTE PRODUCTS (W.P.). Of you accumulate 10,000 or more waste products, you will be disqualified from the game.

Name: Arch-Rival Basketball
Description:
According to the Box:

Arch-Rival Basketball Incorporates the thrill and excitement of college basketball action into a distinctively designed board game. It combines the challenge of board game competition with the vigor and drama of traditional collegiate rivalries. It enables you to experience the feud between two arch rivals while enjoying the satisfaction of planning, guiding, and directing your team to victory.

Name: Carlette
Description:
From the box:  "Monte Carlo in the Home"

Carlette is essentially roulette played with a deck of standard playing cards.

Players bet on whether "Court Cards" (face cards), cards of a specific suit, "evens" of a specific color, or specific cards will appear from the deck.  A die is used to determine the cards that will be dealt from the deck and winners are paid.

Components include the betting board, a deck of standard playing cards, a die, red poker chips, a wooden table rake, and the book "Rules of Carlette".

Name: Coast to Coast
Description:
From the box:  "An Educational Action Game for 2 to 4 players.  Learn to Know America While Traveling!"

Game board features a map of the U.S. with a built-in spinner.  Players travel a circular track around around the map visiting landmarks as they go.  A fun way to learn geography!

Players start on NYC, and move the number of spaces indicated by the spinner. Land on a red space, lose a turn. Land on a blue space, go again. First to return to NYC wins.

Name: The Dale Carnegie Game
Description: Based on the best-selling book "How To Win Friends and Influence People", this game teaches the principals of the book and helps players develop more dynamic interpersonal skills.

Name: Card Football
Description:
This is a game that uses a regular deck of cards to simulate offensive play-calling in (American) football. Combinations of colors, suits and pips determine the amount of yardage gained, or lost, when they are drawn from the deck. (For instance, clubs often indicate a botched offensive play.)

Players must choose whether to call a running, passing or kicking play before drawing the cards and this choice effects how the cards are interpreted.

Card Football was published in the book Card Games Around the World.

Name: World Traveler
Description: From the box- World Traveler is an educational board game which expands the players' knowledge of the world. The object of the game is for players to complete their world travels while encountering obstacles and adventures along the way. Two to six players can play the game. The player to finish first is the winner, but other players can continue until they finish their world travels.

Name: Starluk
Description:
From the box:  "The Fortune Telling Game"

Players keep score telling each others' fortunes.  Rules describe group play as well as more traditional tarot use.

The game was shipped in a book-shaped box (one side was shaped like a curved book spine and the others were printed with a design to make them look like book pages) and included a poker-sized tarot deck, a pad of score sheets, and a rules sheet.

Name: A Corner Of Hell
Description:
"A Corner of Hell" is a set of rules designed for fast, enjoyable skirmish level games set in the second World War.
The rules include all kinds of weapons & vehicles, from regular troops to elite.

Name: The Prep Game
Description:
Are you wearing an alligator shirt?  A Polo tie?  What are you driving?  A "woody" station wagon?  Did you have a Teddy Bear as a toddler?  What clubs do you belong to? THE Country Club?

In The Prep Game, players move their calling cards, with names like Muffy, Sissy, or Corky, around a board, collecting scoring cards and visiting places like "Mummy's and Daddy's," the "Chariot Races," "Miss Comer's Dance Classes," and the "Debut at the Plaza."  The players also collect doubling or tripling cards as well while traveling around the board.  The first player to 25,000 points wins.

Name: Pony Ride
Description:
From the box:
Do you like ponies? Experience the country life by playing PONY RIDE. Pony Ride is an educational and fun game where children can learn about a pony barn and a real farm!

In the PONY RIDE game you will... Spin the spinner and follow the hoof prints along the trail through the countryside!

BE THE FIRST PONY HOME TO THE BARN!

Cross a bridge...Jump a jump...Take a shortcut through the apple orchard! Will your pony stop along the trail to eat apples? Will your pony stop to eat grass? OR WILL YOUR PONY BE THE FIRST PONY TO GET HOME TO THE BARN AND WIN THE GAME? This game includes:

The barn box for the ponies The game board with pop-ups The story book about the ponies and farm The rules A spinner And the four pony play pieces: Allie, Pal, Knight and Honey

In the pony ride game, the players ride through the countryside on four friendly ponies:

Honey Pony - is the yellow pony. She is very sweet and loves to be petted. She is gentle and soft. Knight - is the red pony. He is young, playful, and curious Pal - is the black pony. He is smart, strong, and likes to be first. Allie - is the white pony. She loves to run and run and run. She can dance and drink tea!

Remember - you can put your pony's head out of the barn window if you are the first to the barn. The pony can watch. Or put your pony in the green field next to the barn to eat grass!

Players: 1-4 Ages 3 and up Who Wins: The first pony to reach the barn wins. This player must spin a yellow hoof print to enter the barn and win. Note: Reading is not required Instructions tell you how to play different games

Name: The Incredible Shrinky Dinks Game
Description:
From the creator:
This fun and easy to play game allows you to circle the game board and collect Shrinky Dinks from the six different areas of Shrinky Dinks Land.  You will to go into the Shrinky Dinks Maker and shrink to get into Shrinky Dinks Land, collect your five game pieces and then head for the Shrinky Dinks Maker to get big again.  When you’re big, it’s time to race for the finish.

Name: Underdog to the Rescue
Description:
A children's game for 2 to 4 players Ages 6-10. Players race to see who is the first person to rescue Sweet Polly. Spin the spinner, move the number of spaces, look at the hidden tokens.

Simple game for kids.

Underdog rocks.

Name: Transformers Card Game
Description:
From the box:

They come from the planet Cybertron, and now they are on earth to continue their eternal conflict. They are the transformers and they are out of this world.

Joint the transformers in this exciting fun-to-play card game, in which heroic autobots and evil decepticons are joined by the dinobots and insecticons.

The winner is the player who collects the most sets of Transformers.

Based in the Transformers Universe.

Name: Square It
Description:
A 2 player game. Players take turns placing tiles into the grid trying to form squares. Completed squares are marked, and the player gets another turn. When the board is filled, the person with the most squares wins.

This game is the same as the paper and pencil game "Dots and Boxes" played on a 7x7 box grid.

The title of the German edition is just "Square". The German word for the traditional paper and pencil game is "Käsekästchen".

Name: Shaman King Collectible Figure Game
Description:
The starter set for the Shaman King Collectible Figure Game, based on Shonen Jump's   'Shaman King '  television and manga series. The set contains everything needed for two players to begin playing immediately: 8 pre-painted figures, 1 double-sided game map, 6 Shaman King dice and 1 rule booklet.

The gameplay is derived from Sabertooth's Lord of the Rings Tradeable Miniatures Game, with new additions and powers to reflect the summoning magic of battles in the Shaman King setting.

Name: Le Wine Game
Description:
Le Wine Game is a wine tasting party game for 1 to 4 couples.

The host selects four wines, places them on numbered locations on the "game board," and lets each person sample the four wines. A notepad/scoresheet is provided for each couple to take notes on the wines. Then the wines are removed, and the host again distributes samples of each wine to the guests. The guests now attempt to identify the wines using their notes. The first taster or team to call out the correct identification is declared "Wine Judge of the Evening."

The game is designed to help players learn about wine. Wine tasters are encouraged to file away their notes in a note box (provided) so that they may have "a permanent record of all your wine tasting impressions."

Name: Big League Manager Baseball Game
Description:
Big League Manager Baseball contained two large charts, which were accessed by using a 100-number spinner. Each player (pitcher and batter) has their own card. One fairly unique aspect of the game was that the pitchers had a separate rating for giving up hits with men on base as they did for bases empty.
All the standard options are available. The instructions are copyright 1958 and the charts 1963 in a set representing the 1968 season.

Name: The Shadow Game
Description:
Be the player to win the battle against Shiwan Khan. To go into battle, you must have a Margo Lane card, a Reinhardt Lane card, and the Phurba in your possession.
Players take turns moving The Shadow pawn and following the instructions on the space.
Collecting cards is very important throughout the game. When you collect a card, keep it secret it your hand. Some cards are needed for the final battle, some you play on your turn or another player's turn. No player may have more than four cards at a time.
If you have the necessary cards and the Phurba and it is your turn, you can battle Shiwan Khan by rolling the Phurba dice five times. If you get doubles in that time, you win. Otherwise, you surrender the Phurba and continue.

Name: Tummy Ache Junk Food Game
Description:
The object of the game is to feed "Tommy Tummy Ache" his favorite Junk food without giving him a "Tummy Ache"
The players take turns (according to a spinner, not alternating), placing food on the mouth of the cardboard Tommy Tummy Ache character. If the food is placed improperly, the food will all spill and the player must use one of their tummy ache pills to make him better. This continues until all but one player has used up both their tummy ache pills.

Name: Thomas & Friends Card Game: Station Celebration!
Description: You are trying to collect the card of a same color to make a matching set og items: engine, gift, ticket and invitation.  It basically a matching game, where you are matching colors instead of pictures.
Families: TV Shows: Thomas the Tank Engine

Name: Hälge: Jaktfeber
Description: You take the role as "Hälge" the Moose and are supposed to move around in the forest (the board) collecting elk antler. To win you need to find 12 of them. But in the forest the hunters Edwin, Uffe and their dog Blixten (Flash) lurks making the life hard for Hälge.

Name: Scrabble: Simpsons Edition
Description: The Simpsons edition of Scrabble features several rule changes from the regular game.  Players can play special cards on their turn to help them or hinder their opponents.  Certain words popularized by The Simpsons are permitted (notably KWYJIBO).  Also, the bonus squares on the playing board are arranged in a different, irregular pattern.

Name: The Magic of Football
Description: Make the best team as coach, play the tournament and bring your team to the final.

Name: Cram!
Description:
From the Publisher: 
'The phenomenal new board game where college life collides with pop culture. Cram! is the intensely competitive laughing, guessing, acting, drawing, singing, shouting game for your whole body. On the riotously fictional Cram State University campus, players form "Study groups" to move around the campus and engage in various high energy, pop culture related courses including Cramspeak, GroupTroups, TimeTrivial, Illustronomy, Lyriculous, and Slangshot. Watch out! Your extra-curricular goofing off might affect your grades! Ages 13 and up, absolutely no real education required!'

Players are formed into two teams (study groups).  Each group circles the board (the campus) twice, stopping to be graded on challenges (classrooms).  From the winning study group, the two players with the highest score (grade) go on to compete for Doctor of Culturology.

From the box:
'Cramspeak - use sounds, gestures, words, phrases and charades to get your StudyGroup to shout out the right answers.

GroupTroupes - Shout out answers based upon a performance by your entire StudyGroup.

Illustronomy - Your StudyGroup must guess the answers based upon your multiple drawings.

TimeTrivial - Your entire StudyGroup must guess the correct answer to a multiple choice trivia question.

Lyriculous - You sing the tune to a popular song and your StudyGroup has to name it.

SlangShot - Your StudyGroup must provide as many slang words for a common word or phrase as possible.'

This game was the winner of the "All Star Radio Networks" 2002 Party Game of the Year.

Name: Sproing
Description:
SPROING
The Action Game of Unbearable Fun!

AGES: 7 to Adult
OBJECT: Get rid of your cards in hand, but also avoid getting stuck with the discard pile cards when the SPROING tray goes "SPROING!"
EQUIPMENT: 1 Special SPROING pop-up discard tray
54 Numbered Cards consisting of: 32 Blue Cards and 22 Yellow Cards
1 Bag
6 Multi-Colored Plastic Chips

Each player in turn discards a card in the special SPROING tray before it pops up. Yellow action cards add excitement to the game by directing players to roll dice, find color chips in a bag or count out loud before discarding a card.

This curious game relies on a coiled plastic tray that may be pressed down to become held in place by a sucker. The sucker holds the tray down for about 1.5 minutes (according to the makers) before suddenly releasing the tray, allowing it to pop up and scatter all cards that happened to be on it.

Players try to play a card that is either a '1' or a number higher than the top card on the tray. The blue cards are numbered from 1 to 10, with lots more 1s than other numbers. The yellow cards are numbered from 1 to 9, but also have actions described on them that must be performed by the next player. The next player has to complete the actions before they are allowed to play their card. The actions could require players to count (for example, from "Sproing 1" to "Sproing 10"), roll a specific combination on two special dice (each die has 3 blank sides and 3 sides showing a coiled spring), or draw a chip of a specified color from an opaque bag.

Anyone unfortunate enough to have the tray pop up during their turn has to keep all scattered cards, which count as points against the player who owns them. The player with the lowest number of points wins.

Name: Carlo Derby
Description:
Carlo Derby is a depression era horse racing game.  It comes in an orange and white tube with all the components rolled up in an oil cloth track.  The game contains a layout cloth, race tickets, ticket punch, five horse and a mixer called the "carlo box".  The carlo box contains 6 white marbles, 5 red, 4 blue, 3 green and 1 black.
As the marbles are dispensed, the horses advance. There are three raised felt circles below the track that receive marbles when you push the carlo box down.  The track has a fast and a muddy (slow) lane for each horse.  For example, the black horse fast track has only one space, which means he finishes the race the first time his marble comes up (1/19).  The black horse muddy track has two spaces.  You can bet on horses to win, place or show, and the payoff odds are shown on the track.  For example, black pays 8.5 to 1 for a win on the fast track or 24 to one for a win on the slow track.
The best part of this game is the quality of the molded glass horses.  The tickets are also very realistic looking.
The designer and publication date are unknown.  However, the game is described as patent pending, and the company address is 268 First Street in San Francisco.

The "carlo box" could also be found (with the same marbles) in the game Lido

Name: Strike Price
Description:
Strike Price: The Options Trading Strategy Game.

From the rule book: "The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player. Players try to increase their wealth by buying and selling stock, puts and calls in response to various events, tips, and other players' activities".

There are three versions of the game - the Basic Game, the Advanced Game and the Advanced Game with Optional Rules. The Basic game includes put, call and stock purchasing. The Advanced Game adds borrowing, short selling, and the writing of option contracts. The Optional Rules are available for those players wishing to add even more realism at the expense of playability.

Name: Good Humor Game
Description: A children's game that teaches matching and counting using something they all love: the Good Humor Ice Cream Truck!! The truck moves around the path dispensing the many treats that the children have learned are there. The winner is the first player to collect four cards with the same flavor.

Name: Get in Gear
Description:
From the back of the box:

A Challenging Race to Avoid Pitfalls in the Road and Reach the Finish Line First!

Out of Gas! Flat Tire! Cows on the road!

Players "drive" their cars on the ever-changing road, trying to avoid oil slicks, broken glass, accidents, and more. You decide how far you will drive each turn by how many dice you choose to roll. Green lights mean GO so the more green lights you roll the farther you can travel. But if you roll a red light you can't go anywhere - - - -

As you make your journey you must watch the instruments on your dashboard, too. You may run out of gas, or your engine may overheat.

Name: One Hundred & One Romantic Nights
Description:
One Hundred & One Romantic Nights: A Romantic Game for Lovers

This comes with two custom six-sided dice and an brief instruction brochure in a card-backed plastic bubble package. The two dice have sides that read:

1) Home Escape, Hugs & Kisses, Star Gazing, Talk, Show Time and Love Notes

2) Go for a Drive, Dinner, Picnic, Breakfast, Naughty but Nice and Go for a Walk.

One Hundred & One Romantic Nights is for every couple who believes that there can never be too much romance in their lives. With a simple roll of the dice it's easy to spice up nights & weekends. And with over one hundred combinations, this game guarantees a lifetime of unforgettable romantic nights.

Instructions:
Roll the dice secretly if you plan to surprise your lover, or roll the dice together and start play immediately! Use either one or both dice together and refer to the mini guide for pointers if necessary. Play everyday or once a week, but remember to play regularly. Time & place is always up to you.

Keep in Mind...
Have fun with each roll that you take. Give & take encouragement. Dare to go out on a limb and try something new. Do what you can afford & improvise when necessary. And above all else, enjoy yourself and your loved one at all times.

While the expression of romance has changed over the course of time, the underlying purpose has always remained the same. Romance is about escaping from the grind of everyday life to share a magical moment with the one you love.

Lover's Choice: The Essence of Romance, Carson City, NV

Name: More Urban Myth Volume #2
Description:
More Urban Myth Volume #2 is a card game follow up to the 2002 board game.  There are 194 game cards divided into 6 categories.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to spell the word TRUE or MYTH by collecting the letters on the back of the game cards.  You collect game cards by correctly guessing which cards contain true statements, and which ones are myths.

Each card has either a letter (M-Y-T-H-R-U-E) or is a wild card.  Wilds can be used as any letter.

Players take turns drawing cards, announcing the category and then reading the statement printed on the card to the player to their left.  That player then guesses TRUE or MYTH, if they are correct they get the card.

Name: El Retrato Espanol: Del Greco A Picasso
Description:
"A game which stimulates the mind."
Instructions: Shuffle the pieces face down and then form a square with them. Each player in turn turns over two pieces and the one who finds the most matching pictures is the winner.

What is interesting about this particular variation of picture  matching is that the pictures are actually portraits found in the Museo Nacional Del Prado (Prado National Museum).
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Magic Cauldron Game
Description:
Players aim to be the first to fill their cauldron in this mathematically educational game for children Ages 4 - 8.

The ingredients cards each have a number on the reverse.  When a player has his turn, he turns it over to reveal a number.

Sum cards are spread out on the table.  The player drawing an ingredient card, has to find a sum (using =,-, x) that equals the number on the ingredient.  They then rub the "magic black ghost" on the back of the sum card.  If that number equals the one on their ingredient, then they get to add that card to their cauldron board.

You need 10 ingredients to fill your cauldron and win the game.

You can play an alternative version whereby the sum cards are turned over one at a time and the ingredient cards are spread out on the table.

Name: Schillerstraße: Das Spiel
Description:
From Spiele-Offensive:

Convince your fellow players of the advantages of Italian men. Get a case of beer from somewhere, anywhere. Or get everyone together to practice a Canon. A total of 132 bizarre directorial instructions await the players.

When Uncle Fritz tries his hand at being a sports reporter or sister Lucy puts on her famous cucumber facial, everyone can't help but laugh. Using the director's instructions, each player must improvise a short scene that incorporates all of the directions.

Name: African Queen
Description:
A very rare and interesting abstract strategy game by Alex Randolph.
This game is part of the Abacus wood box series.

Name: Ishi
Description:
A Nim-like abstract game played in two parts. In the first part, players place stones on the board, and the player placing the last stone loses. In the second part, players proceed to remove the stones, and the player removing the last stone loses. In order to win the game it is necessary to win both parts.

A key feature of the game is that the number of stones you can place or remove depends on how many stones your opponent placed or removed on the previous turn.

The game was published by Ravensburger as part of their Präsent Series. Each item in this series contained two games; Ishi was paired with Go (the Ishi board is on the back of the Go board, and it uses Go stones as pieces).

Name: Jot!
Description:
Jot is a Scrabble-like game, played on a "write-on, wipe-off" board with special pens.  Rather than building words from a limited number of letters, each player first rolls a special die, which serves both to dictate the limits of his/her word, and as a one-minute timer.  (The die itself is pressure-sensitive, and will start timing when rolled.)

Players must add letters or words to the existing word-pattern, as indicated by the die.  (For example, a die roll of "+2" means they must add two letters to the board, with the result being a still-legitimate crossword configuration.)

A player can always, in lieu of rolling the die, select from a deck of cards that define a general type of thing (e.g. "birds," "sports," "words beginning with 'R'") The player must add a word that meets the criterion of the card.

Points are scored for number of letters in newly formed words, with standard Scrabble-like bonus spaces applying.  First player to set number of points wins the game.

Name: Bella Lanella
Description: A game about knitting sweaters for shorn sheep: a very simple pattern matching game for young children.  Colorful, with lots of variations as the players get older.

Name: On to Richmond American Civil War Miniature Rules
Description: Brigade level CW miniatures rules.

Name: History of War: Italian Expansion Set
Description:
The Italian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces the Italian forces into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Italian expansion also introduces a new card type: the upgrade. These cards can be played on units and give them some unique abilities. The Italian Set may not be played stand-alone although it has starter-size too!

Expands

    History of War

Name: History of War: Russian Expansion Set
Description:
The Russian Set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It introduces the Russian forces to History of War. This expansion has base improvements, territory improvements, units, action cards and upgrades as well as other sets of HoW - but is not playable stand-alone. The mixture of the cards concentrates on the new Russian units and is only supplemented by the other card types.

Expands

    History of War

Name: History of War: "Fall Gelb" Edition
Description:
"Fall Gelb" is an expansion for the base-game History of War which introduces the French forces into the game. The expansion consists of two sets - one with the French forces and one with the German forces. The expansion may not be played stand-alone although there are included new base improvements, territory improvements, upgrades and action cards as well. But the mixture of the cards concentrates on the units of each side.

Expands

    History of War

Name: Sound Bingo
Description:
Be the first to match all your pictures to the sounds!

An electric toy gives away a sound every time you press it. If you have the corresponding animal or thing on your playing board you close the door to it, and the first one to close all the doors wins.

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Perfectly PINK Booster
Description:
The Killer Bunnies Perfectly Pink Booster Deck adds 55 cards to your existing set, a Highest Enlisted Rank Marker, a Pink Pawn, and a Pink twelve-sided die!

Expands:

    Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

Name: Battle of Manila
Description:
A very early Parker Brothers game (often mentioned in histories of the company), 
Battle of Manila is a Spanish American War boardgame  with chromolithographed box lid and board with Manila Bay, 15.5" x 19.5" x 2" high.

Unlike today's heavily detailed "conflict simulations", this game apparently mainly involved hitting soldier targets on a board with hand held cannons firing wooden "bullets".

This game did help cement Parker Bros. reputation as a patriotic American company, helping sales and its image with the American public.

Name: A Guerra do Yom Kippur
Description: Wargame based on the Battle of Deversoir in the Yom Kippur War, 1973. This game was inspired by the 1975 SPI's Chinese Farm and was published only in Brazil in the early 80's, along with SPI's Wurzburg and Strike force 1 (A Batalha das quatro horas), as part of a collection called "Todos os Jogos" (only these three were wargames, however). They came all together in a ziplock and no boxed versions were available.

Name: Wetten Dass ...?
Description:
Based on the famous TV-show. From Spiele-Offensive:

Excellent, the bet's good! Whether alone or in a team, with the actors, artists, or even "Wanna Bet...?" bet, each player / team has difficult tasks to complete in five different categories in order to reach the betting couch and win the game.

Name: Football Frenzy
Description:
Overview (from publisher's website):

Football Frenzy is an easy to play strategy football game. You don’t need to know how to play football to play! You get to call plays just like the real coaches based on what play you think the other player is going to call. You then reveal your choices and the game system tells you what happens.

The game even includes turn-overs, touchdowns, field goals, safeties, and more!

Key Points:

- Very easy to play. 
- Good for ages 7 and up. 
- Learn the basics of real football as you play. 
- Plays so quickly, you can play while watching a game on TV. 
- Each play takes 5 seconds to run. 
- Games can be played in 30 minutes.

Component List:
- Built-in Tutorial and Help Windows in Vassal 
- 40 Full Color cards 
- Full color Football field

Target Audience:
This is a great game for football fans and people who know football fans.

Game Formats:
Virtual Tabletop (via vassal online system)
PDF Download

Name: Vampire Wars: The Antagonists
Description:
First Supplement for the Gothic Horror - Vampire Wars miniature rules set from West Wind Productions.

No new rules but provide stat's for 5 new vampire counts & 5 new slayers as well as henchmen, 2 immortals, and scenarios for all of the new figures.

Name: Dungeon Twister: Mercenaries
Description:
An expansion in the Dungeon Twister series of games. As all expansion, it can be played as a stand-alone game (if you know the rules from the basic game, available on the game website and you have a set of card). You can also combine it with the basic game and other expansions in order to have a different set of team and room each time you play.

This particular expansion is focused on giving characters muscles. Most of them move slower than typical characters, but they are among the very strongest and most diverse characters in their combat abilities.

Expands

    Dungeon Twister

Name: Galactic Space Games
Description: 6 games in a big book (15.5" x 22.5" - closed).  The games are rather simple.  The book came with various bingo chips and dice in one corner.

Name: Merrycourt
Description: An acting and improv game in a Medieval court setting.  Present and try up to 40 cases included in the box.

Name: Space Pilot
Description:
The object of the game is to win the most money by getting to the planets Mercury through Saturn from Earth and claiming their mineral resources.  Each player gets a space-o-meter to record the number of millions of miles they have traveled on each leg of the journey.  Movement is governed by a spaceship spinner that advances from 10 to 90 million miles per turn.  To claim a planet, you have to be the first to have your mileage hit the orbit range of a planet.  For example, to claim Mercury, you have to hit the 100 to 130 million mile range.  If you go over, you have to reverse your direction and  start subtracting mileage for each spin.

Once all planets are claimed, you add up the value of your planets.  These range from 10 billion dollars for Mercury's gold to 50 billion dollars for Saturn's plutonium.  These are very generous sums for 1951!

This game has rich retro decco graphics.  The artwork is very similar to the 2005 Zathura: Adventure is Waiting.  In fact, the spaceships are nearly identical.

Name: Star Trek Game
Description:
The object of the game is to move your spaceship pawn from the Earth to three of six orbiting planets and be the first one to return to Earth.  The game is played on a 36 by 36 grid with the Earth at the center.  Players get fuel cards numbered 1 through 10 to control their movement.  Each turn, you play one fuel card to move your ship that number of squares either horizontally or vertically, but not both.
There are also two fuel ships.  Every player on his turn rolls a die and moves one of the fuel ships.  If you land next to a fuel ship, you can retrieve any one used fuel card.  When you are out of fuel, you can only move one square per turn. You also retrieve any 3 used fuel cards on every planet you land on.
Each planet has a series of 10 to 12 dots that describe its entry/exit orbit.  To leave Earth, you have to follow the 12 orbit dots before you enter the vertical and horizontal grid of open space.  Likewise, when you want to land on a planet, you have to start on the outermost orbit dot and follow the orbit down to the planet's surface.  Sorry, no transporters in this game.

Name: Biker Mice from Mars: Rock... 'N Ride! Card Game
Description: In turn, players grab a card from the messy pile of cards and exchange it with one in their hand. Once a player has obtained 3 Biker Mice, 3 of their bikes, and 1 Lawrence Limburger Card, they win the round and move one space closer to Quigley Field. The first person to reach Quigley Field is the winner!
Families: TV Shows: Biker Mice from Mars

Name: LEGO: Knight's Kingdom – Das Spiel
Description: Announced for Nuremberg...

Name: Barnyard Boogie Woogie
Description: Hilarious game of pantomime will keep players dancing and singing for hours! Roll the colored die, travel around the barnyard game board collecting farm animals along the way. In order to claim an animal card you must imitate the animal. Oink like a pig, Moo like a cow, waddle like a duck, lots of action for young kids and parents too.

Name: BuddhaWheel
Description:
The idea is that players go around a board based on the Buddhist wheel of life. A dice decides which realm he or she is born into and they then move around the section.

A "karma card" decides which realm the player is to be reborn into. The idea is to escape from the wheel and become a Buddha - once you've done that you can opt to go back in to help other players and prolong the game into infinity.

Name: Kleiner Eisbär, kannst du fischen?
Description:
Alternative names:
Plume, sais-tu pecher?
Piuma dimmi sai pescare?

"Little Polar Bear, do you know fishing?" is a memory-like game. Players move little polar bear around a circular track over ice flows. On the back of the flows there are printed fish in 4 different colors. In the middle of the board, there are 16 wooden fish (4 of each color) placed face down. The player has to draw a fish that matches that printed on the floe. Players may decide whether they want to move one, two or three spaces, so memorizing the fish printed on the floes is as important as memorizing those in the center of the board.

Name: Hyborian Risk
Description:
Hyborian Risk is an unofficial Risk variant, themed to Robert E. Howard's Hyborian Age world of Conan the Cimmerian. It was designed by Lewis Pulsipher, and published as an article in the Space Gamer number 37 (March, 1981), pages 16-17.

In addition to the map, Hyborian Risk includes variant rules for initial placement, stacking, reinforcements, and leaders (including Conan and the wizard Thoth-Amon).

Expands

    Risk

Name: Radio Collector: Frontier Gentleman Series Log
Description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Frontier Gentleman, starring John Dehner. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.

Name: Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel Dig It! Action Game
Description:
From the publisher:
Join Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel, Mary Anne, in their race to dig a cellar in just one day.  Use your steam shovel flippers to fling pieces of dirt into the back of the Popperville Trucking Company truck.  Each time your dirt hits its mark, another Popperville towns person joins your crowd to watch you dig.  The first player to collect a crowd of 5 Popperville people wins!

Name: Radio Collector: Fort Laramie Series Log
Description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Fort Laramie, starring Raymond Burr. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.

Name: Das Gurkensolo
Description:
The game features a race of four wooden cucumbers along 12 numbered fields. Each player draws a card showing the order in which the cucumbers should pass the finishing line.
In every turn each player picks two cards containing statements about the race's standings, e.g. "The red cucumber is not ahead of the green cucumber." Now the player must choose one cucumber to move forward by one field or two, if he succeeds in making one of the two statements true and the other one false after his or her move.
The player whose order of cucumbers matches the race's outcome best wins the game.

Name: Mini Pro Golf
Description:
Players Tee-off from the 9 different Tee boxes and proceed down the fairways to the green.

Using the flag to mark the preferred hole on the green each player uses his driver/iron combo club to maximize vertical projection and distance finishing with his/her putter for sinking the final putt.

You can hook or slice the ball by changing the alignment of the club head for truly realistic shots just like you do on real golf courses.

Try to avoid coarse hazards such as water, trees and sand traps as you proceed down the 9 different fairways.

Keep track of up to four player scores at a time using the mini Pro Golf Score Card.

Name: Catan Card Game: Artisans & Benefactors
Description:
The 7th expansion for The Settlers of Catan Cardgame. Künstler & Wohltäter (Artists & Benefactors) was released at Nürnberg 2006. Mayfair Games plans to release an English version on June 24, 2009.

The expansion was originally published as part of the 10th Anniversary Metal-Box, but was later published separately.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Name: The Doctor Lucky Ambivalence Pack
Description:
An expansion for both Kill Doctor Lucky and Save Doctor Lucky.

Inside the usual envelope is a rule sheet and a double-sided eight-part map. One side of the map is the non-sinking S.S. Afgang for Kill Doctor Lucky, the other is the burning Hotel DuBois for Save Doctor Lucky.

Also included are rules for closing and opening doors that can be applied to any game in the KDL/SDL series.

UPDATE: As of 8/10/2013, this is now a free download from Cheapass Games' "BOULEVARD OF BROKEN GAMES".

Name: Voidstriker
Description:
Semi-generic starship combat game played using counters or miniatures. Rules are simple and include a ship construction system. Ready-made ship designs and scenarios are included.

Expanded by:

    Voidstriker Ship Recognition Guide #1

Name: Big Damn Armies
Description: Part of the "Big Damn" line from Crunchy Frog, Big Damn Armies is a fantasy battle game. The rules are very simple, presented on single-sided photocopied sheets. Card stock miniatures with unit stats printed on them are included.

Name: Big Damn Space Battles
Description: A game in the "Big Damn" series from Crunchy Frog, this one is a very simple space combat game. Includes counters and a hex map.

Name: Splatter: The food fight game
Description:
The game comes with 48 cards and a set of instructions.  The players need six-sided dice and to provide a set of 10 tokens for each player.

Turn Sequence:
1. Discard one cover card
2. Draw one card
3. Perform one action
   a. Clean up
   b. Attack
   c. Draw one card
4. End of Turn

"Clean up": Any number of cards can be discarded to remove 2 "mess points" each.

"Attack": Up to 3 cards can be played for an attack, but no more than 1 "food", 1 "bonus", or 1 "aim" card.  The defender may play up to three cards face-down as "cover".  If the defender is missed, he or she may make a "smack back attack" which cannot be defended or retaliated against.  The game ends when one player accumulates 10 or more "mess points".  The game comes with a few very minor alternate rules.

Name: Bild im Bild
Description:
Bild im Bild is a memory game with an art theme.

Players compete to find the most pairs of tiles, matching details to their paintings. The tricky part- the detail tiles and painting tiles are the same size.

Name: Dodeccamente
Description: Dodeccamente from my cursory read of the rules appears to be a Backgammon variant set upon a circle.  It allows for up to 6 players to play and uses 3 dice instead of two, which dramatically increases the complexity.  You still split how the dice move pieces just as in Backgammon (although with a few additional constraints), and you send pieces back to "start" just as you do in Backgammon.

Name: Sketchword
Description: Think Fast! The clock is ticking! First make a word using the letters in your hand and on the Sketchword board. Then... sketch it! If someone guesses your word before time runs out, you score and so does the player who guessed. But each turn is a gamble in this game... do you go for a short, easy word for low points? Or do you take a chance on your drawing skills and try a harder word with a bigger reward? Sketchword is the best word game and the best drawing game combined into one box!

Name: World Wise European Edition
Description:
(Back of box):PUT THE WORLD IN YOUR HANDS with this great new educational family card game! No matter what your age or education level, no matter how little or how much you know about geography, you can be equally competitive.  Parents and children can play and learn together.  Prepare for an upcoming vacation or sharpen your knowledge for a business trip.  Or just relax and have fun.

There is a card for each country on the European continent and each body of water bounding Europe,  as well as wild cards and super wild cards.  Each player must play a card whose geographic location shares a boundary with the card that was last played.  Bluffing and using wild cards add strategy to the play.

Exciting and educational for 2-8 players, Ages 9 - 99

Name: Schnapp zu!
Description: Where is the pelican about to fish? To guess where, the players put down one of their location tiles. Then the pelican is placed. Whoever has guessed right, gets the fish lying on the corresponding place. The pelican only gets the prey if nobody has guessed correctly. Who, with their shrewed guesses, will collect the most fish? For 2-4 players Ages 4 and up. Includes variant for elder players.
